member.name: T:Slb.Ocean.Petrel.UI.Controls.ColorPickerPanel
member.summary: Provides a palette type visual interface for selecting colors.
member.remarks:
This control can also be used, along with some additional code, to integrate a color picker into a Syncfusion Essential Grid table cell. Examples of this can be found through the Syncfusion Dashboard (located at Start -> Programs -> Syncfusion -> Essential Studio x.x.x.x -> Dashboard) under the "View Windows Forms samples -> Essential Studio Samples -> Grid Samples -> Custom Cell Type" option.
See also
GridDropDownCellRenderer,
GridDropDownCellModel and
GridDropDownContainer.

member.name: T:Slb.Ocean.Petrel.UI.Controls.ClickMonitor
member.summary: [SubjectToChange] Provides the ability to distinguish between single and double mouse clicks on a .
member.remarks:
The Windows Forms click events do not easily accommodate scenarios where a single click and a double click perform incompatible actions because an action tied to the event is performed before the action tied to the event. See
Microsoft Article
The class can therefore be used in such cases to distinguish Clicks, Single Clicks and Double Clicks.
In the case of a 'Single Click' (i.e. not just the first of a double click), the order of events will be , .
In the case of a 'Double Click', the order of events will be , , .

member.name: T:Slb.Ocean.Petrel.UI.Controls.ToolTipManager
member.summary: [SubjectToChange] Component which allows the display of an ToolTip on controls.
member.remarks:
The ToolTipManager class can be used in any container. To explicitly specify a container, use the constructor. A single ToolTipManager component typically is used for associating instances of with multiple controls on a single form. After you create a ToolTipManager, use a separate call to the method to associate display a hint to an individual control. Then when the user moves the pointer on a control, the tooltip with its information is displayed. You can call more than once for the same control to change the tooltip that is associated with the control. To get the that is associated with a control, use the method.
The ToolTipManager class implements the interface, which has a single method, . ToolTipManager extends controls on the same form at design time, adding a ToolTip property. For more information about extender providers, see .
member.SubjectToChange: This API is under construction, hence changes may be introduced at a later stage.

member.summary: Shows the tooltip for the specified control.
member.param: The control whose tooltip will be displayed.
member.remarks: An ToolTip will automatically hide when a mouse button is clicked, or when the Method is called. It will also automatically hide when the mouse leaves the control for which it is shown. So if the mouse is not currently within the control passed into this method, it may cause unexpected results, as a MouseLeave will not occur unless the mouse enters and then leaves the control.

member.summary: Shows the tooltip for the specified control.
member.remarks: An ToolTip will automatically hide when a mouse button is clicked, or when the Method is called. It will also automatically hide when the mouse leaves the control for which it is shown. So if the mouse is not currently within the control passed into this method, it may cause unexpected results, as a MouseLeave will not occur unless the mouse enters and then leaves the control.
member.param: The control whose tooltip will be displayed.
The target point (in screen coordinates) at which the tooltip will be shows.
member.exception: Thrown if there is no for the specified control.
